section: TERM OF CONTRACT The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****].
explanation: The contract term is not clearly defined due to redactions. The start date is provided, but the length in years and months and the specific termination date are redacted. This lack of clarity makes it difficult to determine the exact duration of the agreement and creates uncertainty regarding the parties' obligations over time.

section: Notwithstanding any other paragraph of this Agreement, in the event that CONSULTANT dies or is unable to play tour golf at all, ADAMS GOLF may terminate this Agreement on thirty (30) days' written notice. Upon such termination, CONSULTANT and/or CONSULTANT'S estate shall be required to repay ADAMS GOLF for that period of the Agreement not performed by CONSULTANT. The repayment amount shall be calculated in the same way as repayment is calculated under paragraph 8A.
explanation: This section introduces a potentially contradictory and problematic clause regarding repayment upon termination due to death or inability to play. It states that the CONSULTANT or their estate shall be required to repay ADAMS GOLF for the period of the agreement not performed. This seems contradictory because If the contract terminates because of death or disabilty then there should be no repayment. This is because the consultant would not be able to fullfill the rest of the contract.

section: Notwithstanding any other paragraph of this Agreement, if either party commits any material breach of this Agreement, the other party may terminate for cause upon giving fifteen (15) days written notice of such cause and provided the breach is not rectified within such fifteen (15) day period. Upon such termination, CONSULTANT shall be required to repay ADAMS GOLF for that period of the Agreement not performed by CONSULTANT. The repayment amount shall be calculated in the same way as repayment is calculated under paragraph 8A.
explanation: This section introduces a contradictory clause regarding repayment upon termination due to a material breach by either party. It states that if the agreement is terminated due to a breach by ADAMS GOLF, the CONSULTANT shall be required to repay ADAMS GOLF for that period of the Agreement not performed by CONSULTANT. It doesn't make logical sense why the consultant will pay Adams Golf, if Adams Golf breaches the contract.
